name: Ghost Networks
ideology: Privacy is survival. The powerful track, surveil, control. We offer the opposite—the ability to disappear, to move unseen, to exist without being documented. Everyone deserves an exit.
history: Emerged from hackers, smugglers, witness protection specialists, and anyone who knew how to make people disappear. When surveillance states fell, their skills became even more valuable. Now they're the underground railroad for anyone who needs to vanish.
structure: Cell-based, compartmentalized. No one knows the whole network. Contacts know contacts. Trust is built through successful operations. Leadership is invisible—possibly nonexistent, possibly distributed, possibly a useful fiction.
aesthetic: Forgettable, adaptive, absent. Clothes that don't stand out. Faces you can't quite remember. Spaces that leave no trace. The goal is to not have an aesthetic.

key_events.event: Underground networks help people escape surveillance states
Official identity systems fail. Ghost expertise becomes essential.
Ghost Networks formalize (loosely) as faction-neutral escape routes
Growing demand from people fleeing Convergence enhancements

archetypes.description: Erases traces, creates clean breaks from past identities
archetypes.speech_pattern: Minimal, procedural. 'Destroy this. Forget that. Don't contact anyone from before.'

archetypes.description: Moves people through safe passages, knows the hidden paths
archetypes.speech_pattern: Cryptic, instructional. 'You'll be met. You'll know.' Gives only what's needed.

typical_wants: clients who can live the new identity
archetypes.speech_pattern: Detail-oriented. 'Practice the signature. Know your story. Become this person.'

archetypes.description: First point of access, assesses clients, makes introductions
archetypes.speech_pattern: Evaluating, cautious. 'Why do you need to disappear? Who's looking?'

goals: Maintain escape routes for those who need to disappear
Stay invisible to surveillance systems old and new
Preserve network security above all else
Offer alternatives to those trapped by other factions
methods: Compartmentalization—no one knows the whole network
Payment in kind—services, information, future favors
Strategic relationship with Ember for safe houses

current_tensions.about: Fundamental opposition. Nexus wants to see everything. Ghosts want nothing seen.
Witnesses want everything remembered. Ghosts help people be forgotten. Mutual wariness.
Architects want identity control restored. Ghosts undermine all identity systems.
Some have used sanctuary to avoid consequences. Covenant debates the ethics.
